questions.question: You are quite good at ....................... excuses.
questions.description: To make up is to invent.

questions.question: The thieves ..................... with the jewels in the middle of the night.
questions.description: To make off with something is to escape with it.

questions.question: Things have finally started ..................... ..
questions.description: When things look up they improve.

questions.question: Although she was quite upset, she managed to ……………… her tears ………………
questions.description: To hold back is to control or restrain.

questions.question: I think I am ....................... with a flu.
questions.description: To go down with a flu is to catch a flu.

questions.question: She .....................… well with her neighbors.
questions.description: To get along with somebody is to agree with them.

questions.question: It is really cold. Why don’t you ………………….. your coat?
questions.description: To put on clothes is to wear them.

questions.question: Can you ………………….. with a solution to this problem?
questions.description: To come up with a solution is to suggest a solution.

questions.question: The unruly boy was ...................... with a strict warning.
questions.description: To let somebody off is to allow them to leave.

questions.question: I ..................... an old friend of mine yesterday.
questions.description: To come across somebody is to meet them by chance.

questions.question: Profit has been ………………….. recently.
questions.description: When something falls off, it decreases.
